channel.title: journeys on SPASES Lab
channel.description: Recent content in journeys on SPASES Lab

item.title: Visiting the Resilience Alliance in Norway
item.description: .my-right-figure { display: table; float: right; padding-left: 30px; padding-bottom: 10px; } .my-right-figure p + p{ display: table-caption; caption-side: bottom; padding-left: 30px } .figure { display: contents; } .my-left-figure { display: table; float: left; padding-right: 30px; padding-bottom: 10px; } .my-left-figure p { display: table-caption; caption-side: bottom; padding-right: 30px } .figure { display: contents; } “So you’re going to like a week of nerd camp?” - my husband Yes, this particular gathering of researchers had a particular resemblance to summer camp, as we stayed in cabins, meals were shared around long tables, and we even took a field trip.

item.title: From Geo to Geo
item.description: .my-right-figure { display: table; float: right; padding-left: 30px; padding-bottom: 10px; } .my-right-figure p + p{ display: table-caption; caption-side: bottom; padding-left: 30px } .figure { display: contents; } .my-left-figure { display: table; float: left; padding-right: 30px; padding-bottom: 10px; } .my-left-figure p { display: table-caption; caption-side: bottom; padding-right: 30px } .figure { display: contents; } The Geography-Geology building at the University of Georgia (https://twitter.com/UGAadmissions/status/1398002734742347783) I completed my undergraduate degree in geology at the University of Georgia, spending countless hours in the shadow of Sanford Stadium in an easily overlooked building.
